transformers_text: Battle Stadium D O N is a 2006 Japanese crossover fighting game developed by Eight ing and Q Entertainment and published by Namco Bandai Games for the GameCube and PlayStation 2 The D O N in the game's title is derived from Dragon Ball Z One Piece and Naruto the three manga series published by Weekly Sh nen Jump upon which the game is based Both versions of the game received a rating of 26 out of 40 from Weekly Famitsu 1 Battle Stadium D O N is a platform fighter in which up to four players battle on one of 11 dynamic stages in battles based around free roaming two dimensional character movement Unlike other fighting games D O N uses a tug of war fighting system Attacking opponents will knock glowing orbs out of them for players to collect with a bar at the top of the screen indicating what percentage of the orbs in play each character possesses the size and value of these orbs vary depending on the strength of the attack used 2 Players who collect a majority of the orbs will enter burst mode dramatically increasing their speed and attack power To win a fight a player must either collect all of the orbs in play leaving their opponents with none or possess the highest percentage of orbs when time runs out As such a fight can potentially last indefinitely if no time limit is set Characters have access to a host of special moves and abilities with certain characters being able to use temporary transformations to increase their strength Items will also spawn during battle which can be used to attack opponents or induce positive and negative status effects 3 4 The single player mode has the player fight through five rounds some of which have missions with randomly selected goals the higher the difficulty chosen by the player the more missions are given out Fulfilling these missions ' goals rewards the player with coins that can be used in a slot machine upon defeating the boss character allowing players to potentially unlock characters stages and other bonuses 3 5 Up to four players can participate in a multi player session though a multi tap must be used for more than two players for the PS 2 version The game features a total of 20 playable characters 12 of which are available from the start 6
